Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.graphics

Interface SceneObject

All Superinterfaces:
BoundsObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
CircleButton, CircleShape, org.jsfml.graphics.CircleShape, ConvexShape, org.jsfml.graphics.ConvexShape, Marker, Particle, RectangleButton, RectangleShape, org.jsfml.graphics.RectangleShape, Shape, Sprite
public interface SceneObject extends BoundsObject
Defines a set of methods for centering, manipulating an object's texture and computing bounds.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • isCentered

      boolean isCentered()
      Returns whether this SceneObject is set to be centered.
      Returns:
      true if this SceneObject is set to be centered, false otherwise.

    • setCentered

      void setCentered(boolean centered)
      Sets whether this SceneObject has to be centered by keeping its origin at the center of its local bounds.
      Parameters:
      centered - true to keep this SceneObject centered, false to reset the origin to the point (0,0)

    • getTexture

      ConstTexture getTexture()
      Gets the object's current texture.
      Returns:
      the object's current texture

    • setTexture

      void setTexture(@Nullable @Nullable ConstTexture texture)
      Sets the texture of the object without affecting the texture rectangle. The texture may be null if no texture is to be used.
      Parameters:
      texture - the texture of the object, or null to indicate that no texture is to be used

    • setTexture

      void setTexture(@Nullable @Nullable ConstAnimatedTexture texture)
      Sets the animated texture of the object without affecting the texture rectangle. The texture may be null if no animated texture is to be used.
      Parameters:
      texture - the animated texture of the object, or null to indicate that no texture is to be used

    • setTexture

      void setTexture(@Nullable @Nullable ConstTexture texture, boolean resetRect)
      Sets the texture of the object. The texture may be null if no texture is to be used.
      Parameters:
      texture - the texture of the object, or null to indicate that no texture is to be used
      resetRect - true to reset the texture rect, false otherwise

    • setTexture

      void setTexture(@Nullable @Nullable ConstAnimatedTexture texture, boolean resetRect)
      Sets the animated texture of the object. The texture may be null if no texture is to be used.
      Parameters:
      texture - the animated texture of the object, or null to indicate that no texture is to be used
      resetRect - true to reset the texture rect, false otherwise

    • getAnimatedTexture

      ConstAnimatedTexture getAnimatedTexture()
      Gets the object's current animated texture.
      Returns:
      the object's current animated texture

    • updateAnimatedTexture

      void updateAnimatedTexture(@NotNull @NotNull Time elapsedTime)
      Updates this texture for this object. This method is run by the scene loop and does not need to be invoked manualy.
      Parameters:
      elapsedTime - the time since the game started

    • getTextureRect

      IntRect getTextureRect()
      Gets the object's current texture portion.
      Returns:
      the object's current texture portion

    • setTextureRect

      void setTextureRect(@NotNull @NotNull IntRect rect)
      Sets the portion of the texture that will be used for drawing. An empty rectangle can be passed to indicate that the whole texture shall be used. The width and / or height of the rectangle may be negative to indicate that the respective axis should be flipped. For example, a width of -32 will result in a sprite that is 32 pixels wide and flipped horizontally.
      Parameters:
      rect - the texture portion
